purpose.mission: Prevent, detect, and automatically remediate parity degradation in the UD-00 Logic Core and all dependent systems
purpose.rationale: Following the critical parity breach of 2026-01-15 (0.978), this framework institutionalizes systemic defenses to ensure such incidents cannot recur

PPP-COMP-001.name: Continuous Fuzzing Engine
PPP-COMP-001.description: Property-based testing framework running continuously against parity-critical components

PPP-COMP-002.name: Automated Parity Regression Gate
PPP-COMP-002.description: CI/CD gate that blocks any commit causing parity degradation below threshold

PPP-COMP-003.name: Zero-Drift Tolerance Policy
PPP-COMP-003.description: Real-time monitoring with zero tolerance for any determinism variance

PPP-COMP-004.name: Decimal Arithmetic Layer
PPP-COMP-004.description: Mandatory decimal-based arithmetic for all financial calculations

PPP-COMP-005.name: ATLAS Sentinel Enhanced Monitoring
PPP-COMP-005.description: Expanded sentinel coverage for proactive parity-degrading condition detection

PPP-COMP-006.name: Canonical Correction Protocol
PPP-COMP-006.description: Formalized fallback mechanism for parity breach response
procedure: 4. Benson initiates rollback to last known good state

RULE-PPP-001.name: Floating-Point Prohibition
RULE-PPP-001.rule: No floating-point arithmetic shall be used in any Settlement Pathway component
RULE-PPP-001.enforcement: AST analysis at commit time + runtime guards

RULE-PPP-002.name: Parity Floor
RULE-PPP-002.rule: Parity score must remain >= 0.998 at all times

RULE-PPP-003.name: Heightened Monitoring Post-Incident
RULE-PPP-003.rule: 48-hour heightened monitoring required after any parity restoration

RULE-PPP-004.name: Gateway Enforcement
RULE-PPP-004.rule: All state changes must pass through Canonical Gateway during rectification windows
